qas.question: Which century did the lower-case script for the Greek Alphabet originate?
Which century did the Greek alphabet acquire its quadrilinear form?
Overtime which type of letter forms were mixed increasingly into the Greek language script?
Which year is the earliest dated Greek lower-case text?
In which literature is the earliest dated Greek lower-case text?

context: Similar developments have taken place in other alphabets. The lower-case script for the Greek alphabet has its origins in the <a0_0>7th<a0_0/> century and acquired its quadrilinear form in the <a1_0>8th<a1_0/> century. Over time, <a2_0>uncial<a2_0/> letter forms were increasingly mixed into the script. The earliest dated Greek lower-case text is the <a4_0>Uspenski Gospels<a4_0/> (MS 461) in the year <a3_0>835<a3_0/>.[citation needed] The modern practice of capitalising the first letter of every sentence seems to be imported (and is rarely used when printing Ancient Greek materials even today).
